headline: Affirm (NASDAQ:AFRM) Reports Bullish Q4 CY2025
summary: Buy now, pay later company Affirm (NASDAQ:AFRM) beat Wall Street’s revenue expectations in Q4 CY2025, with sales up 29.6% year on year to $1.12 billion. Its GAAP profit of $0.37 per share was 39.5% above analysts’ consensus estimates.

headline: PayPal Q4 Earnings Review: The Capitulation Bottom Or A Deep Value Trap?
summary: PayPal faces challenges, with its core branded checkout growth stagnating and investor confidence waning. Read more on what PYPL plans to do in 2026.

headline: PayPal: Double-Digit Buybacks Turn The Recent Crash Into An Opportunity
summary: PayPal (PYPL) Strong Buy: deep undervaluation (~7x P/FCF), 15%+ buyback yield, strong cash flows, new CEO catalyst.

raw.headline: PayPal: Double-Digit Buybacks Turn The Recent Crash Into An Opportunity

headline: Is PayPal (PYPL) Offering Opportunity After Recent Share Price Slide And Earnings Reassessment?
summary: If you are wondering whether PayPal Holdings' current share price offers good value or just a value trap, this article is designed to walk you through the key signals. The stock last closed at US$41.03, and shareholders have seen a 22.7% decline over 7 days, 31.4% over 30 days, 29.4% year to date, 47.7% over 1 year, 47.6% over 3 years and 85.6% over 5 years. Recent news flow around PayPal has focused on its position in digital payments and how investors are reassessing established fintech...

headline: Salesforce stock gets brutal reality check amid software slump
summary: A year ago, Wall Street praised the software sector as “the next AI focus.” But that narrative is now turning. On Feb. 3, many software stocks took a sharp hit as investors grew worried that advances in artificial intelligence could begin to replace traditional software services. Anthropic ...

headline: PayPal Holdings, Inc. (PYPL): A Bull Case Theory
summary: We came across a bullish thesis on PayPal Holdings, Inc. on CompoundingLab’s Substack. In this article, we will summarize the bulls’ thesis on PYPL. PayPal Holdings, Inc.’s share was trading at $54.08 as of January 28th. PYPL’s trailing and forward P/E were 11.15 and 9.59 respectively according to Yahoo Finance. PayPal Holdings, Inc. operates a technology platform that enables digital payments […]
